parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Well, well done, good, rightly; also used as an exclamation. Neuter of a primary eus; well.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Superlative of elachus; used as equivalent to mikros; least.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
From epi and ano; up above, i.e. Over or on.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
